page.title: 18My Village
page.content: My village Kilmany is a typical old fashioned Scottish village.The white church is small and friendly and is surrounded by a very old grave yard. One stone dates back to the Tay Bridge disaster;many are older than that.Most of the houses are farm cottages owned by Lord and Lady Kilmany.Nearly every house in the village stands on the road side with the main gardens at the back.The post office and sohool both closed about three years ago. There is a disused railway line,a siding and buildings.It is good fun to play up the railway among the trees as there is no-one to stop you.The railway closed in 1948 .Beside the burn there is a great variety of bird life.The road running up to the A914 is thought to have been an old roman road.
